thread.title: U.S.-Stock Funds Rose in 2017, but Investors Kept Swimming in Foreign Waters

author: William Power
title: U.S.-Stock Funds Rose in 2017, but Investors Kept Swimming in Foreign Waters
text:
When is an 18%-plus gain in the average stock fund not something to boast too much about?
Answer: When the rest of the world has done better.
In 2017, the average diversified U.S.-stock fund registered a total return of 18.3%, according to Thomson Reuters Lipper data. Strong, yes, but international-stock funds rose 26.8%.
